readParseDependencyPackageJson.title: âš ï¸ Warning: Could not process package.json for dependency '{depName}'.
readParseDependencyPackageJson.details: This occurred after any configured retry attempts. Last error: {errorMessage}
causes: - The dependency '{depName}' might not be installed correctly (try 'npm install' or 'yarn install').
- The package.json file might be corrupted, malformed, or unreadable.

readParseRootPackageJson.title: âŒ Critical Error: Could not read or parse the main package.json for your project.
readParseRootPackageJson.context: This error occurred after potential retry attempts (if configured) and is preventing the tool from analyzing your project.
solutions: - Ensure you are running this script from the root directory of your Node.js project.
- Verify that 'package.json' exists at '{projectPkgPath}' and is not empty or malformed.
- Check file permissions for the path.

versionConflict.title: âŒ Node.js Version Conflict Detected
versionConflict.minRequired: Minimum Node.js version required by one or more packages: {globalMin}
versionConflict.maxAllowed: Maximum Node.js version allowed by one or more packages: {globalMax}
versionConflict.conflictExplanation: Conflict: The minimum required version ({globalMin}) is higher than the maximum allowed version ({globalMax}). No single Node.js version can satisfy all declared 'engines.node' constraints.
solutions: 1. Review 'engines.node' in your project's 'package.json' and in those of its dependencies to find the conflicting declarations.
2. Consider updating dependencies; newer versions may have more compatible Node.js requirements.
3. Adjust your project's 'engines.node' in its 'package.json' if it's overly restrictive or directly causing the conflict.
4. For problematic individual dependencies, check their issue trackers for known compatibility issues or consider seeking alternatives.

invalidRangeString.title: âš ï¸ Warning: Could not parse the Node.js version range string "{range}".
invalidRangeString.details: This range string was found in an 'engines.node' field but could not be fully understood.
causes: - The string might contain unsupported operators or syntax.
- There might be a typo in the version range.
solutions: - Please check the 'engines.node' field for the package associated with this range.
- Ensure the range string adheres to standard semver range syntax (e.g., '>=14.0.0', '^16.0.0 || >=18.0.0').

semverIntersectError.title: âš™ï¸ Error: An internal error occurred while trying to intersect semver ranges: {range1} and {range2}.
solutions: - This may indicate an issue with the semver parsing library or an extremely complex/unusual range combination.
- Please report this error along with the problematic version ranges if it persists.

info.noConstraintsFound: â„¹ï¸ No specific Node.js version constraints were found in the project or its direct dependencies.
info.dependencyProcessed: ðŸ” Analyzed: {depName} (Node requirement: '{nodeEngine}', Effective: min {min}, max {max})

retryAttempt.title: âš ï¸ Operation '{operationName}' failed (failure {failureCount} of {maxConfiguredRetries}). Retrying in {delayMs}ms...
